extendedIngredients.name: almond flour
extendedIngredients.original: 3/4 cup almond flour (I highly recommend ordering Benefit Your Life brand online. It is texturally superior to Bob's Red Mill, it's organic and it keeps in the fridge for a very long time.)

extendedIngredients.original: I've prepared this bread with 1/4 cup popped amaranth added to the mix, too. Give it a try.

title: Gluten-free Amaranth Jalapeno Bread
summary: Gluten-free Amaranth Jalapeno Bread is a dairy free recipe with 2 servings. For $2.68 per serving, this recipe covers 23% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 725 calories, 21g of protein, and 26g of fat. 23 people found this recipe to be flavorful and satisfying. A mixture of water, spread into pan evenly and bake, ground sea salt, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 40 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 79%. This score is good. Try Gluten-free Apple Walnut Amaranth, Skillet Amaranth Cornbread (gluten free ), and Herb and Garlic Amaranth Crackers {vegan and gluten free} for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Chili works really well with Cava, Grenache, and Shiraz. These juicy reds don't have too much tannin (important for spicy foods), but a sparkling wine like cava can tame the heat even better. One wine you could try is Papet del Mas Cava Brut. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 15 dollars.

productMatches.title: Papet del Mas Cava Brut
productMatches.description: Pleasant fruit aromas and a bright, clear color. The taste sensation in the mouth is very pleasant, light and well balanced, fresh and very cheerful feeling, good persistence, with fruit and flower notes. The aftertaste invites you to continue savoring the wine.

instructions: Lets get started.Preheat oven to 350F. Chop jalapeno and set aside.
